text: Borussia Dortmund (Ballspielverein Borussia 1909 e.V. Dortmund, BVB, BVB 09) is a German women's handball team from Dortmund. They compete in the Handball- Bundesliga Frauen since 2015-2016 season, the top division in Germany. They won the Handball-Bundesliga Frauen in 2020. ==Honours== *Handball-Bundesliga Frauen: **Winners: 2020 **Bronze: 2000 *DHB-Pokal: **Winners: 1997 **Finalists: 2016 *EHF Challenge Cup: **Finalists: 2003 ==Team== ===Current squad=== :Squad for the 2020-21 season ;Goalkeepers * 1 Rinka Duijndam * 26 Isabell Roch * 30 Yara ten Holte ;Wingers ;LW * 18 Johanna Stockschläder * 19 Jennifer Gutiérrez Bermejo ;RW * 11 Tina Abdulla * 31 Kelly Vollebregt ;Line players * 6 Clara Monti Danielsson * 20 Merel Freriks ;Back players ;LB * 10 Inger Smits * 21 Kelly Dulfer * 66 Dana Bleckmann ;CB * 4 Alina Grijseels * 14 Delaila Amega (injured) ;RB * 8 Tessa van Zijl * 43 Jennifer Rode ===Transfers=== :Transfers for the 2020-21 season ;Joining * Delaila Amega (CB) (from TuS Metzingen) * Tessa van Zijl (RB) (from HSG Blomberg-Lippe) * Clara Monti Danielsson (P) (from Team Esbjerg) * Jennifer Gutiérrez (LW) (from CBM Elche) * Tina Abdulla (RW) (from Tertnes HE) * Jennifer Rode (RB) (from Bayer 04 Leverkusen) ;Leaving * Caroline Müller-Korn (CB) (to Buxtehuder SV) * Leonie Kockel (RB) (to HSG Bensheim/Auerbach) * Saskia Weisheitel (PV) (to Jeanne d'Arc Dijon Handball) * Bogna Sobiech (LW) * Asuka Fujita (RW) (to CS Minaur Baia Mare (women's handball) * Aleksandra Zych (RB) (to CS Măgura Cisnădie) ===Notable former players=== * Franziska Heinz * Eike Bram * Michaela Erler * Silke Gnad * Nadine Härdter * Ulrike Stange * Nadja Nadgornaja * Clara Woltering * Svenja Huber * Narcisa Lecușanu * Lidia Drăgănescu * Tonje Sagstuen * Kari Solem * Ágnes Farkas * Míra Emberovics * Virág Vaszari * Bogna Sobiech * Aleksandra Zych * Emilia Galińska * Hildigunnur Einarsdóttir * Kim Eun-mi * Asuka Fujita ==European record== ===EHF Champions League=== {| class="wikitable" !
